etymology.description: Phonetic: 爿(爿) (pán, "bedsteads") + Semantic: 士(士) (shì, "scholar") = indicating a scholar's bedding or stature -> strong
etymology.interpretation: In 壯(壯) (zhuàng, "strong"), the component 爿(爿) (pán, "bedsteads") imparts the sound, while 士(士) (shì, "scholar") suggests the robustness or elevated status of a scholarly person, metaphorically extending to strength.
etymology.simplification: 壮(壯): 士(士) (shì, "scholar") was simplified to 夂(夂), a less complex shape, while retaining the phonetic and semantic association.

examples.chinese: 经过锻炼(經過鍛鍊)，他的肌肉变得更壯(他的肌肉變得更壯)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò duànliàn, tā de jīròu biàn dé gèng zhuàng.
examples.english: After training, his muscles became even stronger.

examples.chinese: 古代战士常被赞颂为壯志凌云的英雄(古代戰士常被讚頌為壯志凌雲的英雄)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhànshì cháng bèi zànsòng wéi zhuàngzhì língyún de yīngxióng.
examples.english: Ancient warriors were often praised as heroes with lofty aspirations.
